channel.title: Barrows minigame help
channel.description: Hello, i building a barrows minigame and i having a problem with adding it ok so i made a boolean ( wonAhrim ) becuase i want to add [b]ONLY[/b] if i won all the other brothers i can go to the treasure [b](THAT WORK LIKE THIS RIGHT?)[/b] so i need help making it so when i kill the ahrim the boolean wonAhrim will go to true; I HAVE CLIENT.JAVA AND NPCHANDLER.JAVA i know i can add the wonAhrim = true; in there but i always got a problem with making the custrcuctor (client bla = new client(); ) so how can i do it? [b][size=12pt]and the barrows miningame work like i said before right?[/size][/b]

item.title: Barrows minigame help
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

I have one folder called “Server” and in it i have all the java file’s so how to import? and in client.java i dont have this shit
public client() {
this.c = client;
}
and stuff idk how it is please help me bro? ASAP i cant do nothing right now… ty!

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows minigame help
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Nope mines called client.java… can you help me ?

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows minigame help
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

That’s because it needs to be Client, not client.

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows minigame help
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Please dont logout… i still need you so wait bro ;D

EDIT: Btw ite delta. and look at those two errors when i added this:

        public static client c = new client();
NPCHandler.java:5: cannot find symbol
symbol: class client
location NPCHandler
        public static client c = new client();
                         ^
NPCHandler.java:5: cannot find symbol
symbol: constructor client()
location class client
        public static client c = new client();
                                       ^
2 errors

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows minigame help
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[code] public Client c;

public NpcHandler(Client client) {
	this.c = client;
}[/code]

or

public static Client c = new Client();

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows minigame help
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Ty bro but i know i can make that method i am not that begginer so when i want to use a diffrent class (Client) for another class (NPCHandler) so i have in the NPCHandler
a check when i kill a npc. So when i kill the ahrim npc i want to add there C.wonAhrim = true; (ill add a message if wonAhrim = true to check if it works.) but anyway if i want to make a “C”. something i need to do this no?
client C = new client(); or something but it always stuck me (thats what i cant make another class all needs to be in the main class and this is “client.java” so if you can help me that i will really really apperciate this and you also know what is
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException?

EDIT: now when i thinking of it if you will help me doing this client C = new client();//i can acctually make another file instand loading the barrows thing from client.java too…

item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

public void checkWon() { if (wonAhrim == true) { //do something.. } else { //do something.. } }

then just call checkWon()

also, i don’t understand what you mean by ‘i always get a problem with making the constructor’ - tell me more…

constructor for the client class or constructor for the barrows class?
